ch.aplu.android.bluetooth

Class BluetoothPeer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.bluetooth.BluetoothPeer

  • public class BluetoothPeer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements a Bluetooth peer-to-peer communication based on the client-server model. When started, an running server is searched with a specified Bluetooth service. If found, the connection is established in a client mode. Otherwise a server mode with the given service name is started.

    Data is exchanged as integer blocks of arbitrary length.

      Constructors

      Creates a BluetoothPeer instance that tries to connect to the given node using the given service name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BluetoothPeer

        public BluetoothPeer(android.app.Activity activity,
             android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice partnerDevice,
             java.lang.String serviceName,
             BluetoothPeerListener listener,
             boolean isVerbose)
        Creates a BluetoothPeer instance that tries to connect to the given node using the given service name. When the call returns, the connection is established or we are waiting as server for an incoming connection. isPeerConnected() can be called to check the case.

        The given listener receives notifications about connection status and incoming data blocks.
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity from where to get the BluetoothAdapter
        partnerDevice - the BluetoothDevice of the partner node. If null, starts immediately as Bluetooth server
        serviceName - the Bluetooth service name used for the communication channel
        listener - the BluetoothPeerListener that receives notifications
        isVerbose - if true, information of all data exchanged is displayed in debug console

    • Method Detail

      • sendDataBlock

        public void sendDataBlock(int[] data)
        Send a block of data to the connected node. Returns immediately if not connected.
        Parameters:
        data - the data block to send

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection status. If the current instance is a server, returns true, if a client is connected. If the current instance is a client, returns true, if it is connected to a server.
        Returns:
        true, if connected; otherwise false

      • releaseConnection

        public void releaseConnection()
        Releases a connection as client or server. If no connection is established, nothing happens. You should call this cleanup method to be sure that the Bluetooth service is shutdown.

      • isServer

        public boolean isServer()
        Checks if the current instance acts as server.
        Returns:
        true, if the current instance behaves like a BluetoothServer; false, if it behaves like a BluetoothClient
